Citation Text: Clarkeet al (2010) and Liang et al (2011) describe approaches for learning semantic parsers from questions paired with database answers, while Goldwasser et al (2011) presents work on unsupervised learning

Reference Text: ['<S sid="1" ssid="1">Compositional question answering begins by mapping questions to logical forms, but training a semantic parser to perform this mapping typically requires the costly annotation of the target logical forms.</S>', '<S sid="2" ssid="2">In this paper, we learn to map questions to answers via latent logical forms, which are induced automatically from question-answer pairs.</S>', '<S sid="8" ssid="4">On the other hand, existing unsupervised semantic parsers (Poon and Domingos, 2009) do not handle deeper linguistic phenomena such as quantification, negation, and superlatives.</S>', '<S sid="9" ssid="5">As in Clarke et al. (2010), we obviate the need for annotated logical forms by considering the endto-end problem of mapping questions to answers.</S>']
